reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed in this small but charming boutique hotel and were very satisfied with all the amenities. Our room was small but very clean and neat. The bathroom had plenty of hot water in the shower with good water pressure. The beds were comfortable - not luxurious. The staff cleaned and freshened up the room daily. The breakfast buffet in the lower level had plenty of choices and was well stocked. It was open early and late enough to accomodate eating any time of the morning. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful - from making a pot of tea for us in the afternoon, to resolving a booking problem with a tour we had scheduled, to suggesting sights to visit during our stay. They all spoke English very well. The location was perfect - 2 blocks to the Eiffel Tower, a few steps to the lively and well known market street, Rue Du Clef, with restaurants, a patisserie, an ATM machine, and other charming shops. The metro stop was a 5 minute walk away. The neighborhood was quiet and there were no disturbances at night even with the windows open. There is also access to the internet in the lobby. I would visit this hotel again.
reviews.title: Charming Boutique Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A nice 2** hotel in a great location. Upon arrival there was no water in the hotel and the elevator wasn't working due to repairs That inconvenience only lasted a few hours. We were given room 504 whcih is a very small corner room. The air conditioner wasn't working iand the room was extremely hot. We requested to be moved after the 1st night as the room was 27C. We were moved to a room on the 2nd floor that had air conditioning that worked. Once moved no further problems. Staff were friendly and assisted re transportaion, dinner reservations. Rooms were clean and the bed reasonably comfortable. Would recommend, but try not to stay on the 5th floor where the rooms are smaller.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can only add what others have said regarding this small hotel. We just returned from a four night stay. First of all, the staff is etremely nice and polite and all requests are seriously considered and met. The rooms are small but then that's Europe, especially Paris where space is at a premium. Yes, the rooms are a bit worn but then there is a renovation in the works t according to the photo in the lobby and the room we saw(courtesy of housekeeping) it will be ultra contemporary (alas paris seems to be going that way). however, that's the slightly downside. The location is perfect, the rooms are clean with nice amenties and our room had a view of the top half of the Eifel Tower. For pricey Paris, thought we got an ok deal with breakfast (which is very good) and a two day museum pass. It is a slight walk from the metro but then don't even consider Paris if you don't like to walk. There are at least four excellent restaurants within a two minute walk from the front door of the hotel (We heartedly recommend the La Petite Nicose) All in all, a nice stay. Do have to add with a bit of a chuckle because it always seems to be the case, the rooms are not exaclt as they appear on the website.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room we had, 505, was small but expected, newly decorated and clean. We could see the Eiffel at night from our room. They have hairdryers in each room and an iron you can borrow from the front desk. The hairdryer in the bathroom has an outlet fit for U.S wattage that we used to plug our cell phones into but you will need a converter for anything else. We only had two issues, the closet in this room was more like a cabinet without a bottom in it. The cabinet took up most of the wall space on one side of the bed and if you weren't careful could hurt yourself (which we did a couple of times). The other issue was the shower, there isn't a shower curtain so by the time your done water was everywhere and there isn't a shelf to put soap, shampoo, etc. All in all minor things we could live with and we would definately stay here again. I went in a friends room, 404, and it was a corner room with two windows, also with a view of the Eiffel. This room was much larger, has a bathtub with a shower and full sized closet. If we go back I'd probably opt for this type of room if available.

Christmas at Cadran
reviews.text: Aside of the convenience of the location - the streets around the hotel are the best we came across in Paris. They were lively with Parisians doing their clothes shopping from nearby boutiques, buying their groceries, drinking expresso's in cafe's, drinking wine and eating dinner under heat lamps on the cobbled streets. We felt like we got a real picture of Parisian life - which is what we wanted, only a stones throw from the Eiffel Tower. The fact that it was Christmas made it even better. The streets were lit up beautifully and christmas tree sellers and german market-style stalls lined the streets.

reviews.text: Hotel du Cadran is a great place for a long weekend holiday with husband or girlfriend. We especially liked being so close to the Metro, the wonderful markets on Rue de Cler (great olive oi store!) and the restaurants and bistros close by when we didn't want to venture out any further. Hotel is very easy to get to by Metro from Gard du Nord. The hotel has a very friendly staff who are eager to help you, breakfast fills you up, and it's a great place for women to stay who are traveling alone. I went with a girlfriend this time but my husband will come with me the next time so it's nice for couples, too. If you're not looking for a fancy place but clean (and a great shower!), close to restaurants and transportation, this is the place. I highly recommend!

reviews.title: Hotel du Cadran, Paris
reviews.text: Nice hotel in a great location. The rooms were not large but clean and comfortable, we were out most of the time anyway. I noticed at reception that the rooms were due for renovation, the bedrooms were a little tired and out of date. The bathroom was very clean and there was lots of hot water and a great shower. We had asked for a room with a view and were a little disappointed not to get this. We were given Room 407 (superior, king size) which was at the back of the hotel with no view but it was very quiet- which was good. There was lots of choice at breakfast tea, coffee, fruit juice, various cereals, youghurt, fruit, jam,cheese and ham. There was also plenty of toast, french bread and of course fresh croissants. Our breakfast was included in the price of our stay. There are a few supermarkets nearby and lots of cafes and restaurants, though we mainly ate at night in the Latin Quarter which had lots of choice, nice food and cheaper menus than elsewhere. The only down side of our visit to Paris was the number of homeless people living rough, especially on the banks of the Seine. There seemed to be people begging at all the tourist spots and we were constantly warned about pick-pockets. Watch out for the "oh, I have just found this gold ring, could you give me money for it if I give it to you". You have been warned, please be very careful!

reviews.title: Very Enjoyable!!!
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Cadran for a week in early March 2007. I have to say I was very impressed. The location was excellent. The hotel is situated within a two minute walk to L’ Ecole Militaire metro station. You could walk to the Champ de Mars and get a great view of the Eiffel Tower within ten minutes. We would often walk to see it lit up at night. It was so good having this icon so close. In fact all the great sights were within about a 30 minute walk of the hotel. However my favourite and lasting memory was the Cadran’s proximity to Rue Cler. The fresh food markets on Rue Cler were so fantastic. We sampled everything from crepes, to cheeses, wine and bread. I felt we had the ultimate Parisian experience right at our doorstep. There were also a number of nice bars and restaurants around the area. The staff at the Cadran were friendly (with one exception) and knowledgeable. The rooms were not enormous but I thought were good quality for the price. Unfortunately our bath plug was faulty so we couldn’t have baths but that is a minor complaint. Another minor problem was the air-conditioning. The room was quite hot at night and the air-conditioning didn’t seem to work. The stay was also somewhat marred by the arrogance of one staff member, a grumpy old man, who was on reception the night before we left. We had paid to use the internet for half an hour, however 5 minutes into our session the hotel computer crashed. When I went and told the grumpy old man what had happened his response was: “So what do you want me to do about it”? I had never experienced such rudeness our entire stay and found his attitude very frustrating. We explained that we needed him to re-enter the password into the computer. However he was still too lazy to do his job, so he gave me the password, “CADRAN”. So if you do stay here give that password a try for some free internet time. Also on our final day, our stay was further marred by the airport pick up service that the hotel had arranged. Our car failed to turn up. This probably was not the fault of the hotel, but I remain slightly sceptical. But enough of the negatives. In all it was a very positive experience staying here. I loved it and would definitely stay again despite the minor problems.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 4 nights from 26th April 2007 and can only add to the glowing reviews with regards to the quality and location of the hotel but with the following proviso, of note particularly for visitors thinking of staying here before May next year. The amenities state that the hotel has air conditioning but does NOTsay that it is only on during the summer months - May to September! During our stay the room temperature never dropped below 28C but staff were adamant that it could not be turned on before the usual date as it was controlled via an external source. As there was a heatwave on we found the nights particularly uncomfortable and may not have stayed here had we known about the restrictions. Otherwise we would really recommend this place and would stay here again (between May and September!).
reviews.title: Great hotel but a word of warning...
